results.title: Composition: as pattern, as structure, as expression
results.creator_credit: Eve Cotton and Center for Humanities
results.brief_description: The arrangement of the elements within a painting is examined. The program shows how the masters have organised their paintings according to the principles of good composition: pattern, from Gozzoli to Matisse; structure, from Pollaiuolo to Cezanne; expression, from Sassetta to Degas.
results.title_for_label: Composition: as pattern, as structure, as expression

results.title: Community responsibilities
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In good citizenship where does a person’s duty to the community end? Where does obligation to oneself or one’s family begin when apportioning one’s spare time and energy? These questions come under vigorous discussion when a member of an urban community is approached by two of his neighbors to head a worthwhile community project. He declines on the grounds that one such commitment leads to another, to the extent of infringing on his personal freedom. One of his neighbors feels he is shirking responsibility in refusing; the other thinks perhaps he is right in resisting community pressure. The audience is invited to discuss the matter.

results.title: Commercial sexual exploitation of children
results.creator_credit: Gail Price, Nicholas Bird and ECPAT Australia
results.brief_description: Discusses the global issue of commercial exploitation of children and the various forms this abuse can take, eg prostitution, slave-trade, pedophilia, internet pornography. Mentions some of the causes as being poverty, homelessness, consumerism, absence of child protection, cultural and traditional practices and a growing child sex tourist trade. Also talks about positive strategies that can be taken at all levels, local, regional, national and international. ECPAT is an international network of organisations committed to ending the commercial exploitation of children. Formed in 1991, ECPAT now reaches to over 50 countries globally and closely works with various government departments, such as Tourism and Child Welfare. Cast: Michael Brakensiek, Sarah Hill, Michael Williams, Afshin Nikousheresht. Narration: Patrick J. Bonello, Damian Nicholas.

results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: Bill Reid, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Here, in cinema verite style, film is used as a means of letting a family look in on itself, at the differences of outlook, lifestyle and values that separate the parents and two grown sons. Completely unrehearsed, it is a record on film, of a few days’ visit back home on the part of the older son (the filmmaker) and of the conversations that took place among the four in a genuine though abortive attempt to reach mutual understanding. The film is an example of the communications barrier that divides many families.

results.title: Comic relief
results.creator_credit: Geoff Posner, Paul Jackson, Philip Chilvers, Ed Bye, Richard Curtis, Roger Graef, BBC-TV and Comic Relief
results.brief_description: A live show to fight famine in Ethiopia and the Sudan, recorded on April 4, 5, 6 1986 at the Shaftesbury Theatre, London (home of the theatre of comedy) featuring some of Britain’s top comedians and entertainers including Rowan Atkinson, Billy Connolly, French and Saunders, Stephen Fry, Kate Bush, Ben Elton, Bob Geldof, Rick Mayall, Cliff Richard, Midge Ure, Spitting Image and more. NB: Uncensored and includes material which some people may find offensive.

results.title: Comet
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Uses animation and appropriate commentary to explain the effect and influence of comets upon the planet Earth. Examines the knowledge of comets over the centuries and spends some time discussing Halley’s comet.

results.title: Colour bars
results.creator_credit: Fabio Cavadini, Mandy King and Auburn Community Development Network
results.brief_description: This non-observational documentary made for SBS Independent is about the lives of five young Australians of non-English Speaking Backgrounds. They were born or raised in Australia and have experienced the ups and downs of growing up in at least two cultures; that of their parents and the mainstream culture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fabio Cavadini, Mandy King and Auburn Community Development Network

results.title: Colourful notions (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Colour vision must have evolved to serve some practical purpose. Dr. Edwin Lord has a new theory that colour is not the property of objects at all but the result of complex calculations which the brain performs to ensure that objects can be recognized under a wide range of light conditions

results.title: Color me lurid: the weird world of George Kuchar
results.creator_credit: George Kuchar, Argus Films and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: A compilation of underground filmmaker George Kuchar’s “crazed, revved-up and stripped down melodramas… perverse, funny but strangely poignant.” Twenty years before “Blue Velvet”, Kuchar and his twin brother Mike were obsessed with pop culture and kitsch. Part of the New York “underground”, they were unusual in wanting to make lavish melodramas featuring hand-painted titles, lurid colour and sound, tabloid-type tales, startling hair-dos and vivid costumes.
results.title_for_label: Color me lurid: the weird world of George Kuchar
